item.title: Guardians of the Galaxy Set Images: First Look at Michael Rooker as Yondu!
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: < 1 minuteWe got a rare glimpse into the filming of the upcoming Marvel film, Guardians of the Galaxy, the other day and …

Guardians of the Galaxy Set Images: First Look at Michael Rooker as Yondu! was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

We got a rare glimpse into the filming of the upcoming Marvel film, Guardians of the Galaxy, the other day and today there is even more. 

This time it’s Michael Rooker as Yondu along with the film’s director, James Gunn.

There’s been a flurry of Guardians of the Galaxy news lately, with Gregg Henry announcing his involvement plus Bradley Cooper’s talks with the studio regarding Rocket Raccoon.

The film is scheduled to open in theaters on August 1st of next year.

Guardians of the Galaxy Set Images: First Look at Michael Rooker as Yondu! was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: Transformers 4: First Look!
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: < 1 minuteWe’ve seen images from Transformers 4 before, but this is our first “official” look at the upcoming film. This first look …

Transformers 4: First Look! was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

We’ve seen images from Transformers 4 before, but this is our first “official” look at the upcoming film.

This first look at Transformers 4 comes to the internet courtesy of director Michael Bay himself.

Bay uploaded the picture to his site, MichaelBay.com with the caption “Just another day on the set of Transformers 4. Pictured left to right: Jack Reynor; Mark Wahlberg; 2nd Assistant B-Camer Casey “Walrus” Howard; 1st Assistant B-Camera John Kairis with back to camera; B-Camera Operator Lukasz Bielan; Director Michael Bay; and Director of Photography Amir Mokri.”

Nice to see the crew of the film getting a shout out along with the film’s stars Wahlberg and Reynor.

Transformers 4 hits theaters on June 27th of next year.

Transformers 4: First Look! was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: Thor: The Dark World Stills: Check Out Christopher Eccleston!

Thor: The Dark World Stills: Check Out Christopher Eccleston! was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

New Thor: The Dark World stills have been released and we get a fantastic look at Christopher Eccleston as Malekith!

The new stills are courtesy of the newest edition of Empire and feature not only Eccleston but Tom Hiddleston as Loki and of course Chris Hemsworth as Thor.

Click through the jump to see even more Thor: The Dark World stills!

 

Thor: The Dark World opens in theaters on November 8th.

Thor: The Dark World Stills: Check Out Christopher Eccleston! was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug Trailer Gets The Lego Treatment
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: < 1 minuteWe’ve seen The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug teaser trailer before, but now the internet has come through again with a …

The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug Trailer Gets The Lego Treatment was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

We’ve seen The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug teaser trailer before, but now the internet has come through again with a Lego trailer.

Check it out below!

Pretty well done, especially the "falling down a waterfall in a barrel" part. 

It is this stop-motion style that The Lego Movie trailer seems to be paying homage too. Always nice to see the fans and their creations getting a nod from the higher ups.

The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug Trailer Gets The Lego Treatment was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: You’re Next Reviews: Can the Horror Film Knock Out The Butler?
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: < 1 minuteThe home invasion horror opens in theaters and looks to take Lee Daniels’ The Butler out of the top spot in …

You’re Next Reviews: Can the Horror Film Knock Out The Butler? was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

The home invasion horror opens in theaters and looks to take Lee Daniels’ The Butler out of the top spot in the box office race.

Earlier in the summer, The Conjuring took over the box office in fine fashion. Can You’re Next follow in it’s scary footsteps?

Check out these You’re Next reviews, compare them to The World’s End reviews and see which way you’ll turn at the theater this weekend!

Injecting the home-invasion thriller with fresh DNA, Adam Wingard’s “You’re Next” strays just enough from formula to tweak our jaded appetites. — Jeannette Catsoulis, New York Times

 

Funny and tense, rather than hilarious and terrifying, You’re Next doesn’t rip up the rulebook but it’s definitely read it. — Matt Glasby, Total Film

Most of these characters are disagreeable, so the prospect of their imminent demise isn’t too upsetting. — Mark Jenkins, Washington Post

This is smart, frightening, and funny material that’s an invigorating kick in the genre’s ass. — Mark Dujsik, Mark Reviews Movies

A film of repetition, a bloody dance consisting of three steps: stab, scream, repeat. — Scott Bowles, USA Today

It clicks as an exercise in suspense and well-paced, slowly unfolding answers. — Frank Lovece, Newsday

You’re Next Reviews: Can the Horror Film Knock Out The Butler? was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: The World’s End Reviews: How Does the Cornetto Trilogy Wrap Up?
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: 2 minutesSimon Pegg and Nick Frost have teamed up with Edgar Wright for the third of what is being called the “Cornetto …

The World’s End Reviews: How Does the Cornetto Trilogy Wrap Up? was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: 2 minutes

Simon Pegg and Nick Frost have teamed up with Edgar Wright for the third of what is being called the “Cornetto Trilogy“.

Does the trio capture the magic of Shaun of the Dead and Hot Fuzz for a third film?

Let’s turn to the critics, see what the The World’s End reviews have to say, then you can compare them to the You’re Next reviews and make weekend plans!

There are times when I’d kill for a pint, but I don’t think I’ve ever been ready to die for one. That, however, is the situation faced by Gary King (Simon Pegg) in the hilarious pub-crawl-meets-apocalypse that is The World’s End. — Chris Knight, National Post

 

Don’t feel excluded if you haven’t seen the zombie comedy Shaun of the Dead and the buddy cop comedy Hot Fuzz… because The World’s End stands on its own as hilarious high-end nonsense. — Joe Morgenstern, Wall Street Journal

Wright knows how to keep the energy spinning, but he also doesn’t know when to stop. — Rafer Guzman, Newsday

Simon Pegg is on fire here, giving a truly balls-to-the-wall performance as Gary. It’s his best ever, especially as he partakes in an all out bar brawl without spilling a drop of his pint — Laura Clifford, Reeling Reviews

This inspired nutball comedy is like its heroes on their mission: It just gets progressively more nuts, more blotto. — Steven Rea, Philadelphia Inquirer

Capping a summer movie season when humanity was practically extinct every other weekend, Wright gives Armageddon a funnier name than even This Is the End did. — Steve Persall, Tampa Bay Times

The World’s End Reviews: How Does the Cornetto Trilogy Wrap Up? was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: Inside Llewyn Davis Trailer: Cat and Guitar, No Coat
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: < 1 minuteAnother trailer has been released for the upcoming Coen Brothers film Inside Llewyn Davis. Starring Oscar Issac, Carey Mulligan, and Justin …

Inside Llewyn Davis Trailer: Cat and Guitar, No Coat was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

Another trailer has been released for the upcoming Coen Brothers film Inside Llewyn Davis.

Starring Oscar Issac, Carey Mulligan, and Justin Timberlake, the film tells the story of a folk singer as he attempts to survive as a musician in Greenwich Village in 1961. 

Check out the newest Inside Llewyn Davis trailer below!

You can pre-order the Inside Llewyn Davis soundtrack from Nonesuch now and it will be released on November 12th. The film opens in theaters on December 6th.

Inside Llewyn Davis Trailer: Cat and Guitar, No Coat was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: Divergent Teaser: Full Trailer To Premiere During VMA Broadcast!
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: < 1 minuteIt seems like we’ve been waiting for an eternity, and the Divergent photos have done a decent job as tiding us over, …

Divergent Teaser: Full Trailer To Premiere During VMA Broadcast! was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

It seems like we’ve been waiting for an eternity, and the Divergent photos have done a decent job as tiding us over, but finally we get to see the first footage from the upcoming film.

Check out the Divergent teaser below!

The full Divergent trailer will premiere this Sunday during the broadcast of MTV’s Video Music Awards.

Starring Shailene Woodley and Theo James, Divergent is based on the extremely popular Veronica Roth novels. 

The film opens in theaters on March 21st.

Divergent Teaser: Full Trailer To Premiere During VMA Broadcast! was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: Pompeii Trailer: Kit Harrington’s Abs Vs. The Volcano
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: < 1 minuteEveryone’s favorite not-a-virgin is making his way to the big screen. Kit Harrington, most famously known as Jon Snow from Game …

Pompeii Trailer: Kit Harrington’s Abs Vs. The Volcano was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

Everyone’s favorite not-a-virgin is making his way to the big screen. Kit Harrington, most famously known as Jon Snow from Game of Thrones, stars in the upcoming Pompeii. 

A teaser was released for the new film and despite it showing almost nothing plot wise, we do get a nice look at Harrington… and his abs.

Check out the Pompeii trailer below!

Along with Harrington, the film stars Emily Browning, Kiefer Sutherland, and Jared Harris. Pompeii was directed by Paul W.S. Anderson (Mr. Milla Jovovich) and is scheduled to hit theaters on February 21st. 

Pompeii Trailer: Kit Harrington’s Abs Vs. The Volcano was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.

item.title: Lee Daniels: Janis Joplin Biopic Next On Director’s To-Do List
item.dc:creator: Amanda Denton
item.description:
Reading Time: < 1 minuteLee Daniels is no doubt enjoying the great The Butler reviews but now that his work on that film is done, he’s …

Lee Daniels: Janis Joplin Biopic Next On Director’s To-Do List was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
item.content:encoded:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

Lee Daniels is no doubt enjoying the great The Butler reviews but now that his work on that film is done, he’s moving on to his next project… Janis Joplin.

The project isn’t new by any means, THR reported on it back in September, but Lee Daniels is now confirming that the biopic of the 60s singer will be next up for him.

Amy Adams has already signed on for the lead role which should add another another notch in her belt. She’s taken on many different genres and roles so Janis Joplin seems like the next logical step.

 

Also on Daniels’ horizon? A film adaptation of Claude-Michel Schonberg and Alain Boubil’s popular musical Miss Saigon. Given Hollywood’s love of musicals in recent years, this could be a very good move on Daniels’ part. 

Lee Daniels: Janis Joplin Biopic Next On Director’s To-Do List was originally published on The Hollywood Gossip.
